Comments_List: Learned about the process of research
I learned how to manage a long-term research project.
I learned computational techniques for BME and how to piece together my own project.
Really appreciated being able to explore something I'm interested in!
A class to do research for a semester, with advising from your selected PI. Learned to do individual research, writing, etc.
I learned a lot about neural networks, PET, brain images, and ODEs!
I learned how to generate my own MATLAB code to solve vascular mechanics problems.  I also learned about academic writing and research.
Very little structure was helpful because it allowed for independent work. However, I would have appreciated a bit more guidance getting advisors and projects.
It was a good course, and it really is what you make of it! maybe more advising on the front end could be helpful

This course is very open-ended, more so than the senior projects for other majors.  You can do pretty much anything for your thesis.  This is both good (more independence to do what you are interested in) and bad (I wasn't sure what the expectations were).
Required to graduate for biomedical engineering majors.
yes, do something that makes you truly interested though
if you're a senior in BME, yes! you've got no other option
Mandatory, a lot of work, but a highly valuable experience.
